p: There is still no consensus regarding the amount of vitamin D that should be ingested due to between-person and population variabilities. It is important to notice that the daily reference intakes are given for periods where sun exposure is low, as in winter, and lately the recommended levels of intake are much higher than in the past. A recent meta-analysis using food-based approaches that incorporates individual data concludes that an intake of ~12 Î¼g/day could prevent vitamin D deficiency (i.e., serum 25-hydroxycholecalciferol < 30 nmol/L) in adults in the absence of sufficient ultraviolet B (UVB) radiation [ 90].
